sourceMeaningMnemonic: I have <radical>sick</radical> in my <radical>skin</radical>. Just look at it, it doesn't look too good. Whenever I have sickness in my skin, I know that I'm probably <kanji>exhausted</kanji>.
meaningInfo: Imagine yourself being really, really exhausted. Then look at your skin. It's all sickly looking.
readingMnemonic: When you're <kanji>exhausted</kanji>, your muscles are all probably worn out. Being this worn out, you can probably imagine that your body is all <reading>hea</reading>ted (<ja>ひ</ja>) up, from all the exercising.
readingInfo: Imagine exercising so much that your body gets all <kanji>exhausted</kanji> and <reading>hea</reading>ted (<ja>ひ</ja>) up.
